chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Paul A Mayworm was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 9 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to DNA surcharge ($250) and Blood draw fee ($35) - PAID IN FULL.    Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Town of Oconomowoc Police Department.
Maintain employment and/or combination of school.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Cash bail applied to fine.  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Reply to defendant's Motion for Reconsideration of Petition for Sentence Adjustment.

Motion for Reconsideration of Petition for Sentence Adjustment filed by defendant
  ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 10-19-20.** Request denied without the necessity of a hearing.
Order Denying Motion for Reconsideration of Petition for Sentence AdjustmentSigned by Judge Laura F. Lau on 6/12/20

09:06 AM Defendant Paul A Mayworm by phone, in custody.  Kristi J Gordon appeared by Zoom (video) for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties agreed to have the hearing conducted remotely under the Standing COVID-19 Order requirements. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Court addresses the Motion for Reconsideration of Petition for Sentence Adjustment.  Statement by defendant.  Arguments by the State.  For the reasons stated on the record the Motion for Reconsideration of Petition for Sentence Adjustment is denied.
Motion hearing on June 12, 2020 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Paul A Mayworm in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  
Jury Trial Canceled.
 

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.
Count 3 is dismissed by operation of law.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  54 Months.
Initial Confinement:  21 Months.
Extended Supervision:  33 months.
9 Days Credit.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

36 Months D/L REVOCATION
36 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 ( to be forward to Town of Oconomowoc Police Department);
FINE:  $3,039
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail - Balance to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant to be transfered to D.C.I. - FORTHWITH.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Various character reference letters filed on behalf of defendant by Attorney Huppertz.
